selected_quotes: The Correlation Between g Loadings and Heritability in Russia New one from Nijenhuis calling corr. …
Me recuerda a esto que encontraba que en Rusia NO son más heredables los tests de CI con más peso en el factor g
Negative correlation (from -0.45 to -0.6) between g loading and heritability in a Russian sample
Negative correlation (from -0.45 to -0.6) between g loading and heritability in a Russian sample h/t @hbdchick

citation.abstract: The study focused on the extent to which the general factor of intelligence g and heritability coefficients of the subtests of an IQ battery correlate. Modest to strong positive correlations were found in five studies from Western countries and six studies from a Japanese meta-analysis. The results for Russian twins were compared with those of the Western and Japanese studies. Data from 402 twins aged 13 and 296 twins aged 16 showed correlations of r=-0.45 and r=-0.60, respectively. It is concluded that the two data points are clearly not in line with established findings. It may be that the link between g loadings and heritabilities is more complex than previously thought.
citation.title: THE CORRELATION BETWEEN g LOADINGS AND HERITABILITY IN RUSSIA
